description.narrative:
MSB's Somalia programme for the period October 2014-September 2015 has three components: 1) Secondment of an Aid Coordinator to Somalia's Ministry of Finance; 2) Secondment of three experts to UNMAS; and 3) Secondment of a Humanitarian Aid Coordinator to the Informal Humanitarian Donor Group.
The intervention has been requested by the embassy and the programme has been developed with a terms of reference from the embassy as a basis. Initially there was another component, regarding temporary offices to the Ministry of Health, included in the programme. Since it was recently discovered that there was uncertainties regarding the land ownership of the suggested construction site together with IDPs living there and comments by the embassy's Quality Assurance Committee regarding sustainability and ownership, it was decided that this component should not be implemented for the time being. The dialogue with the Ministry of Health continues and support might be provided through another implementing partner. This change implies that the risk profile of the programme is significantly reduced.

MSB:s Somaliaprogram under perioden oktober 2014-september 2015 innehåller tre delar: 1) Sekondering av en Biståndssamordnare till Somalias Finansministerium; 2) Sekondering av tre experter till UN Mine Action Service (UNMAS); och 3) Sekondering av en Humanitär Biståndssamordnare till den Informella Humanitära Givargruppen.
Insatsen har efterfrågats av ambassaden och MSB har utvecklat programmet utifrån en arbetsbeskrivning (ToR). Initialt inkluderades ytterligare en komponent rörande tillfälliga kontor till hälsoministeriet. På grund av sent uppkomna oklarheter rörande landägarskap, internflyktigar och kommentarer från ambassadens kvalitetssäkringskommitté rörande hållbarhet och ägarskap med mera beslutades det att denna komponent inte ska genomföras för tillfället. Dialogen med hälsoministeriet fortgår dock men eventuellt stöd kommer att kanaliseras genom en annan implementerande partner. Detta medför att programmets riskprofil har sänkts markant.

The programme had three overall objectives:1) UNMAS: To enhance FGS capacity to mitigate explosive threats and improve weapons, ammunition and explosive management capacity. 2) Ministry of Finance: To increase MoF institutional capacity, functionality and efficiency to better serve as a coordinator and recipient of donor and tax revenues to the benefit and needs of the Somali people, with a particular focus on women and girls. 3) Humanitarian Aid Coordinator: To improve the quality and effectiveness of humanitarian action in Somalia in its capacity of benefit and needs of the Somali people, with a particular focus on women and girls.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Some examples of results that has been achieved include: - The MSB EOD expert planned and produced training package that was implemented with the SPF EOD team. - The MSB scondment of WAM expert (Weapon and Ammunition's Management) assisted and strengthened the Somali Federal Government (FGS) weapons and ammunition management. - The same WAM expert was also central in assisting the FGS in establishing a national legislative framework on WAM resulting in a draft Small Arms and Light Weapons law and private security law. - The seconded MSB experts has been instrumental in establishing necessary functions, routines and installations required for the FGS to maintain a fully functional life cycle management of all weapons and ammunition management. - Ownership (and Sustainability) has also to some degree been pushed by this intervention, with a gradual increase in the involvement and commitment of the Somali authorities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
